review_title: Knox is a wonderful institution and a pretty good employer
job_title: Faculty Administrative Assistant in Galesburg, IL
pros: Pro-family/ work-life balance, overall population of faculty and staff is kind, warm, and generous, free tuition benefit for employees and family members.
cons: Very little opportunity for growth, slow decision making, slow to make changes, leadership at the mercy of endless faculty committees, a few negative personalities seem to have way too much power in departments that have a ton of crossover.

pros: Great supervisors to help you!
cons: I don’t mind a con!

job_title: Director of International Student Services in Galesburg, IL
pros: People at Knox College have a sincere concern for the wellbeing of students and a desire to assist students in reaching their goals. Professors make themselves available to students by offering generous office hours. I feel inspired by my colleagues to do a good job here and support students to the best of my ability.
cons: Salaries may be a slightly less competitive.

pros: On campus employment and friendly staff
cons: Only minimum wage is paid.

pros: Works with my student schedule, which is fantastic. I get to work with other students, and my own job is rather interesting.
cons: Student work is base minimum wage, and there's a limited number of hours

pros: On campus jobs only for students
cons: Minimum wage paid for all on campus jobs

pros: Filled with fun people. They teach you as you work. Mistakes aren't faults but a way to learn.
cons: Their pay roll system is complicated. The pay is legal minimum.

review_title: Higher Education - Love what you do
job_title: Welcome Center Coordinator in Galesburg, IL
pros: Working with students is an amazing and rewarding experience. The tuition benefit was a big perk.
cons: The pay isn't great. The administration can be difficult. There's not a lot of growth within departments, so there's a lot of turn over.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Small interactive and vibrant. Also diverse
cons: Too remote, and can be confining

pros: This college has a great history, and most of the employees really care about the students.
cons: This was a great place to work when I first started.  It had a very family like atmosphere around campus, the president and his wife were seen often mingling with the kids and eating with them, and they knew each employee's name.  Most of them had been working here most of their lives.  When they hired a new president, things changed within a few years.  I have never seen the woman walk through the kitchen or caf.  I didn't even see her for a year or two. Then they brought in a food management company.  It seems like management is very distant and unresponsive to any complaints.  There is now a hostile work environment in this part of the college that many employees have left.

pros: Great college love working and teaching the students watching them become adults
cons: The President of the college and the new management team in dining services really needs to re-think the way they do things low quality ingredients do not make high-quality food small portions that don’t stay hot lots of space but not enough food overworking the staff students complaining all the time it’s really not a good place to be

pros: Becoming a tutor of Computer Science, Spanish and Psychology has been one of the greatest opportunities from my academic career. I learned several interpersonal skills and critical knowledge to be able to express an abstract idea into something more concrete. CTL (Center of Teaching and Learning) provides valuable training opportunities and certifications from the CRLA (College Reading and Learning Association).
cons: It is very hard to get several working hours, since there is a good amount of tutors. Also, I feel that my former supervisors understood how challenging was to be tutor, which was probably the reason they did not provide a lot of working hours.

review_title: Lab Assistant is possibly the best job on campus.
pros: As a Lab Assistant, there are definitely more perks than most jobs. Of course, you also have to understand that you need to attend to anyone when they come to ask you questions or have concerns regarding something. While you can work on homework, you need to stop doing it once someone approaches your desk because you are being paid to help them.
cons: Some of your colleagues can take it too seriously and so they can be a little rude to you.

job_title: Snack Bar Worker in Galesburg, IL
pros:
- very nice people so even though there is not much of the training going on experienced workers will help you out on your first day. 
- Hours are pretty decent so I can balance studying and working at the same time
cons:
- minimum wage, there are hardly any promotions at least not for part-time workers 
- sometimes the leadership is not too great by being very indifferent to the situation that is taking place at the gizmo (snack bar)

review_title: I enjoyed the people I worked with, but the pay was not very good even though it was "part-time."
pros: I was given a great deal of independence in what I wanted to do. I was allowed nearly complete freedom when it came to what I wanted to teach in my class.
cons: Challenges include sifting through the millions of emails you receive on the faculty distribution list.

job_title: Assistant to Director in Galesburg, IL
pros: Friendly community of faculty and staff. Everyone seems to take special pride in being part of the Knox College community and in making it a better place.
cons: May be changing from people first to, bottom line thinking. The administration has changed and a big emphasis in cutting budgets.

pros: I set most of my own hours. It's a small community, friendly. The are several responsibilities that are necessary for labs to function.
cons: The faculty is competitive, and there is little communication between departments.

pros: Amazing supervisor, great environment, part of community, and was able to genuinely contribute
cons: During finals it could become difficult to complete all tasks, although they were understanding of school coming first.

pros: Get to work in a fun environment and help a lot of people, while polishing my social skills and working on communication.
cons: It is in some ways unrelated to my field of study.

pros: The staff is very collaborative and helpful! The community is generally supportive and good.
